thread.title: US wholesale stockpiles slipped in July, weighed down by oil
thread.title_full: US wholesale stockpiles slipped in July, weighed down by oil - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: US wholesale stockpiles slipped in July, weighed down by oil
text:
By JOSH BOAK
AP Economics Writer WASHINGTON (AP) - Expectations for U.S. consumer spending appear to have dimmed in July, as wholesalers cut their inventories slightly and sales fell.
The Commerce Department says wholesale stockpiles slipped 0.1 percent, while sales dropped 0.3 percent. This follows a solid 0.7 percent gain in inventories and 0.4 percent sales increase in June.
Cheaper oil prices are weighing on wholesalers' holdings, while consumer spending elsewhere has yet to fully offset the steep drop in petroleum costs. Oil inventories - which are measured in dollars - plunged 4.8 percent in July and 19.8 percent over the past 12 months.
Inventories for autos, furniture and groceries advanced in July, while pharmaceutical drugs fell.
Despite the overall July decrease in stockpiles, wholesale inventories are at a seasonally adjusted $584.3 billion, 4.9 percent above a year ago.
